revised_title: Edward Lhwyd's Observations on Natural History and Geology in Wales
tldr: Edward Lhwyd, Keeper of the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, shares his observations on natural history and geology during his travels through Wales. He describes various plants, minerals, and animals he encountered, including rare and undescribed species. Lhwyd also discusses the lack of volcanic activity in the region and his plans to conduct further scientific experiments in the future.
